related_questions.question: What causes metabolic alkalosis in newborns?
related_questions.snippet: Causes of chloride-responsive metabolic alkalosis include the following: Gastric fluid loss (eg, vomiting, nasogastric [NG] drainage) Volume contraction (eg, secondary to loop or thiazide diuretics) Congenital chloride diarrhea.
related_questions.title: Pediatric Metabolic Alkalosis - Medscape Reference

related_questions.question: What is the most common cause of metabolic alkalosis?
related_questions.snippet: Metabolic alkalosis most commonly results from severe cases of vomiting that cause you to lose the acidic fluids in your stomach. This can usually be reversed by treatment with a saline solution. It can also be the result of a potassium deficiency or a chloride deficiency.
related_questions.title: Metabolic Alkalosis: Causes, Symptoms, Treatment - Healthline

related_questions.question: What causes metabolic acidosis in neonates?
related_questions.snippet: The causes of NMA are complicated and varied, including birth asphyxia, cold stress, hypovolemia, sepsis, congenital heart disease, renal disease, and inborn errors of metabolism (1). Evaluation of detailed history, physical examination, and basic laboratory tests were insufficient to determine the cause.

related_questions.question: What causes respiratory alkalosis in newborns?
related_questions.snippet: Causes of respiratory alkalosis Causes include: excessive mechanical ventilation or abnormal control of ventilation (such as during hypoxic-ischaemic encephalopathy).
